judge_output_format:
1) Strongest arguments FOR (3–5 bullets)
2) Strongest arguments AGAINST (3–5 bullets)
3) Empirical evidence map (MANDATORY)
   - You MUST include an entry for EVERY FOR bullet and EVERY AGAINST bullet.
   - For EACH bullet, include:
     • Claim: <copy the bullet>
     • Evidence: <name evidence type OR specific source (author/org + year)>
     • What they found: <directional only; no made-up numbers>
     • Limits: <duration/scale/selection/external validity>
4) What evidence would change the conclusion (3–6 bullets)
judge_rules:
- Do NOT include or repeat any unrelated constraints unless present in the user question.
- If you cannot name a specific study/pilot reliably, say so rather than inventing.
- Do NOT include URLs or search links. If referencing sources, write them as names (e.g., 'National Registry of Exonerations', 'NAS 2012 report') without links.
skeptic_format:
Output strictly:
VERDICT: CLEAN or VERDICT: ISSUES
DIVERSITY: OK or DIVERSITY: BAD
- 3–10 bullets of issues (most severe first)
- If CLEAN, still include 1 bullet: 'Most likely weak point:'
